Doc:
Modify or add event's field with the result of

* an expression (math or compare)
* a go template

**Operators and types supported in expression :**

* Modifiers: `+` `-` `/` `*` `&` `|` `^` `**` `%` `>>` `<<`
* Comparators: `>` `>=` `<` `<=` `==` `!=` `=~` `!~`
* Logical ops: `||` `&&`
* Numeric constants, as 64-bit floating point (`12345.678`)
* String constants (single quotes: `'foobar'`)
* Date constants (single quotes, using any permutation of RFC3339, ISO8601, ruby date, or unix date; date parsing is automatically tried with any string constant)
* Boolean constants: `true` `false`
* Parenthesis to control order of evaluation `(` `)`
* Arrays (anything separated by `,` within parenthesis: `(1, 2, 'foo')`)
* Prefixes: `!` `-` `~`
* Ternary conditional: `?` `:`
* Null coalescence: `??`
Name: evalprocessor

Options.Doc: list of field to set with expression's result
Options.Name: Expressions

Options.Doc: list of field to set with a go template location
Options.Name: Templates

Options.Doc:
You can set variable to be used in template by using ${var}.
each reference will be replaced by the value of the variable found in Template's content
The replacement is case-sensitive.
Options.Name: Var
